Summary: I write as average for a budget minded family.  We had excellent service from all the hotel staff.  We had a handicap room but not a handicap shower.  Room was very clean on the first level.  This is in a Spanish Speaking area but very quiet until about 9:30 pm when if you step outside, you can see many of the Fireworks from Disneyland. This lasts less than 30 minutes and occurs every night. An elevator is available for the 2 upper levels. Entrance to the rooms if from the outside and not a hallway.  The prices are great for a family. The breakfast is quite adequate but not "gourmet"  There are two waffle machines, fruit, yogurt, rolls, cereal, eggs, toast, biscuits and gravy Coffee and tea are available 24 hours. I think this is about what family members would like.  The

This was a wonderful place to visit with my family! very good food around this hotel. definitely will take my family and friends back here soon! I loved the breakfast, and the beds were very comfortable.

Great place to rest to be ready for what the day had prepare the next day. The mattress was very comfortable and it was really clean. The pearson at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. I had no problems and it was spacious. The towels were clean every day I was there and my favorite part was that it was close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: AVOID! Hotel now changed to Studio 6 march 2017.
Summary: Avoid this hotel at all costs.   Rooms are dirty, staff are extremely rude and unhelpful especially the manager Kim and receptionist Laura.  I've never ever come across such bad customer service in my life.  No soap in the rooms and the towels and bed linen were dirty. Air con unit was hanging off the wall and smelt of mould. I would guess you could say at any other hotel locally for the same price with a lot better experience.

Knew we would be out late for 94.7 concert at Honda Center. Clean perfect location and great breakfast!  Beds very comfortable. Microwave refrigerator in room. Friendly staff I will definitely use again.

I ended up with his motel through a Hotwire deal. The room was waaaaay better than we expected. The room and bathroom were clean and updated, and the beds were comfy. It was a plus that the room had a fridge and microwave. The free breakfast was decent. Not much variety, but hey, it was free. Lots of families were staying here--probably because it was so close to Disney.

Please try to avoid Laura, The properties Sales Manager. Completely unprofessional and rude to guests also on front desk jesenia, Gave incorrect information about room charges and deposit policies Cost me half my deposit for nothing  Also one friend from my room complained of bug bites for a week after staying here  STAY AWAY

We stayed 2 nights. The room was clean and a good value.  It was good size room and the bed was comfortable. The staff are helpful and can help with your questions.  I would stay here again. It's a 15 min walk to Disneyland or you can ride the public shuttle. You can buy a pass for the shutte at the hotel office for $5 per person and it will drop you off at the front of the park. The only bad with that is you can end up wating longer then you could walk there.

We only stayed one night until be got into our house we rented.  The rate for room was great and breakfast was free and not bad location was great.  Clean rooms we had 2 rooms overall not bad for the price or the location right down the street from Disneyland.  Staff were nice also.  The only downside is the parking situation other then that great stay.

I stayed here in September-October and had an amazing time. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was better than I was expecting. The location was everything I was looking for. It was a short walk to shopping and a bus stop even closer. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a hotel that is economic that has good amenities and close to shops and far enough away from the tourists to feel like a local. I got to see the fireworks just about every night. I plan to visit again. Thank you Quality Inn for making my first trip to America a wonderful experience.

Recived pretty good rates for a 3 day stay, located right off of the freeway, around plenty of shopping centers, restaurants and theme parks.  Check in was smooth, room was very clean, spacious, contained microwave, fridge and mini stove top range w/a little kitchen area which I would have put to use but wasn't familiar that rooms provided this service which is nice.  Parking was good, pools hours were great my only complaint is that rooms are not very noise proof at all, plus a lot of children running around loud late at night like 11 - 12 pm.

I needed a room for the night, and this place had rooms available. The price was pretty cheap compare to other hotels near by. The service was awesome, friendly staff and very knowledgeable of the area around. My room was very spacious and very clean. They also had a fridge and microwave oven. Most places I have stayed at don't even offer those amenities. I do a lot of traveling and stay at different hotels and this place is definitely A+. If I am ever around the area again, I know where to stay.

Summary: My husband and i stayed in this hotel, checking in on August 2, 2016 and checking out on August 4, 2016.  We wanted something close to Disneyland and reasonably priced.  1 out of 2 ain't bad...  The pricing would have been okay ($96 per night including tax), but we were not expecting the bugs, black mold and urine stained mattress.    First, when we checked in, we were charged a $25 fee.  I asked why we were being charged this fee since we had already paid in full several weeks prior to arrival.  I was never given a definitive answer but told it would be sent back to my account after check out..  I was then made to sign a blank credit card statement.  The $25 was taken immediately.  I am still waiting for it to be returned.  We stayed 2 nights.  We had been in California on a

I've stayed at this Hotel two different times this last week...I'm also a Diamond Elite...We used our points for this place...This Hotel is great for its convenience between the Desert where I live and the Ocean...Lots of Kids and thats because its affordable to stay between the Disney and Knot"s  resorts...Actually a better than normal breakfast for a Quality Inn..Pool is in use...Great for kids...My only negative is I was in a Non Smoking room and my bedspread on my very comfortable bed had cigarette burns.... that is a no no...I've been in much better Quality Inns and much worse...For the Area..and that it is affordable for people with kids and your only here to sleep....this is your place...

I am a Choice Privileges Diamond Elite Member, and I stay at Choice Hotels often for business and for pleasure.  I had more than enough points to give my granddaughter and her family of four a place to stay for their trip to Disneyland.  I was extremely disappointed in their experience.  My granddaughter called me more than once because of all the problems that they were having, and I received no help from the front desk.  On their first night, the lock on the door did not work, and with two young children this was important for my grandchildren and great grandchildren.  They called the front desk, and they were not able to fix the lock so they gave them another room.  In this room, they woke up to roaches on the floor and under the refrigerator. We stayed here while attending a car show. The hotel is in a good location. The room was clean & comfortable. The hot breakfast was good and included waffles, eggs, sausage, coffee, and other items. The hotel staff was pleasant to deal with and we will be back.

This place gives a new meaning to the word dump. Room smells like horse manure. Don't get a room for the weekly rates. The lower price is only for the first week. They will stick you in the back of the building and let you rott away. Huge rip-off.  The place is a ghetto all hours of the night.  People driving through playing loud music.  You might as well just check-in to the motel on crenshaw. Bring a gun and keep it loaded by your side.  Beds are as hard as they they come. The people outside are as loud as they can be. Horrible hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Example of a Good Hotel & Friendly Staff!
Summary: The staff is very friendly! The building is secure in a great location close to shopping, dining & Disneyland! Laura was great as well as the rest of the crew!! Very helpful whenever we had questions. The pool was great, except sometimes not so great with the screaming kids, HA! Their breakfast was good with eggs, pastry, juices & coffee. I was surprised how clean and large the room was also. Definitely large enough for two people. Overall, an excellent value & will stay here again on our next visit to Orange County! A+++

The room was fine. That's why I am giving it a 3 stars. It was an average room, had all the amenities promised. We only stayed for the night. The girl at front desk was horribly rude. As soon as we walked in she just had an attitude. She didn't greet us, she didn't act like she cared she even had a job. I work in customer service and I just can't believe how rude she was. My reservation was messed up through tingo. I tried to ask to speak to a manager but the girl said she could do nothing. I went in 2 different times seeing if we could do anything. I wouldn't have been as mad if she would have been nice and helpful.

Room was fine. Bed was really firm, The pillows were comfortable though. Breakfast was ok but not that healthy. Making this review is annoying though. I should be able to put as little or as much as I want too. The last part is directed at TRIP ADVISOR!!

I was charged $138 dollars additional. This was my Disneyland

And a reasonable place to stay if your on a budget....But you probably will be disapointed. ...not the greatest area..and don't think your near the beach...but you are near enough to most of Anaheim ' s activities...this is the Quality inn north in Anaheim.

This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. First the room they gave me had unmade beds and trash. There were little black flies floating over my bed. The carpet smelled like there had been water damage. WIFI didn't connect most of the time. The pool (hahaha) give me a break. I was suppose to be near Disneyland. There is no shuttle so you can walk (7 miles) or take a taxi or bus. Very OLD 1960s style furnishings and carpet. One word - YUK

Summary Heading: Clean, modern, descent place to stay
Summary: Stayed here for a quick stay. The parking was a bit snug, but the whole city of Anaheim was pretty busy during this weekend. The rooms were clean, the furniture and decor were modern and up to date. It is a good place to stay if you are looking for a nice place to rest. I was glad that they held our room after arriving after midnight, though other hotels would sell the rooms.

I checked into this hotel and immediately checked right back out. We were assigned room 116, within 5 min. of being in the room we found two giant cockroaches! it was so disgusting, the room smelled as if though it was a smoking room and to top it off; once checked out and upon reviewing my bank statement right away i noticed they had charged three separate transactions. one for the room rate $119 plus two other transactions for $15 and $137. I immediately contacted the property and the guy working the front kept mumbling and said oh for "so and so right?" ....wrong! not even my name! he had charged a different guests room on my card!...i explained to him how his mistake had caused me a huge set back due to it was our vacation money and he said he would have the manager call me

Summary Heading: Decent room for a very low price. Average Area
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for just one night. Checked in late and checked out very early.  The young guy that checked me in at the front desk was awesome and super friendly, he was very quick and handed me the keys to my room.  From previous pictures, the room was decent, it was clean and the bedding was clean and modern and the TV was a good size.  The bed was comfortable enough and the amenities. I had a room on the ground floor and the only thing that kept me up were the people walking around all night above me, seems that the floors are not very sound proof, other than that I was perfectly happy with my stay.

This is where we stay when we visit Disneyland. Customer service is amazing, rooms are clean and comfortable for a family of 4 (we had 2 queen beds).  The breakfast and pool are great additions when we need some R&R from the park. Just a hop skip and a jump from Disneyland without being on the main drag.

I have stayed at this hotel many times , couple of reasons,  service to client, great house keeping, and always try to resolve any issue in the most calming manners . Price are averge but i know tht if i have a question or situation they well resolve it in a timely manner.

im currently staying at the quality inn and they say "high speed internet" well for the past 15 mins all I've gotten out of their "high speed internet" is pages timing out from load time. When I do actually get online I want to see what their speed is testing at speedtest.net.    Download speed 0.96mb/s.  Upload Speed 0.94 mb/s. Those both roughly convert to about 110kb/s... With 110kb/s you can't stream anything like Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, etc. Downloading a 1g file will take 2 1/2 hours! A phone that runs 3G cellular network Internet has faster speeds than this place. Don't offer "high speed internet" when you're very far from it.

Stayed here with the family during spring break for a couple of nights and that was about all I could take.   The location is easy to find and parking could've been a headache but we arrived earlier in the evening. Check in was fast and pleasant. The young man at the desk was very knowledgeable of the area and much help.   Being that it was spring break there were A LOT of kids and teens EVERY WHERE! They were not at all quiet but once in the room the noise was not as bad. The pool was packed so we weren't able to use it but it looked old, yet clean. Summary Heading: Clean, basic good for a pit stop to catch some winks
Summary: Traveling around the country there are times you pull off the highway just to get some sleep and then move on.   This is that kind of place for me, not a destination that I would spend time by the pool reading etc.  But it is clean, the people are very nice and breakfast (included) was fine.

Summary Heading: Conference and Anniversary in One Trip!!!!
Summary: After a full day of being at a conference and a long drive to get here prior to the conference we were ready for some rest. We checked in, and within 10 minutes of arriving we were walking into our room. It was clean and looked promising. We had plenty of room to unpack and settle in. It was wonderful being on a ground floor and not having noise coming from any part of the room. We enjoyed our evening and rested up for our trek through Disneyland the next day. The breakfast charged us up for the day, and check out was as easy as check in. Will definitely be keeping them on our favorites list for our next trip.

Summary Heading: Hell hole hotel, Don't stay here!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel a year ago when it was comfort Inn, so I book on line to stay here 1-ngt on February 14th 2015 got to hotel checked in, was assigned to rm 107 to get to room, which was a smoking rm may I add,I  walked in, this rm was filthy there were no towels, no remote for t.v. no ash tray, & no toilet paper  it looked as thou the room had not even been cleaned! So then I went to sit on bed the bedspread was so disgusting I wanted to go throw it in the dumpster, I walked back up to office to complain, & was told that maintenance wud bring ash tray, remote, towels & toilet paper to rm, I said it's so disgustingly dirty, has the rm even been clean? The guy at front desk said um yes I think so, here's  the worst part now there was mold around the tile in tub & shower & on

Not too special here, with a dated set-up and sometimes spotty service. I couldn't make any long distance or even 800-umber calls from the room because something wasn't connected. While not wonderful, breakfast was OK, but I've seen much worse.

Summary Heading: The worst hotel in my life
Summary: I am mexican and I went with my family last July. It was a very dirty room, the bathroom, the beds all of them.  The elevator didn't work. There were people making a barbecue in the first floor because people live here.   The towels were dirty a towel had blood.  In the parking we found a bag of condom.  We Have stayed in Others Quality Inn And This hotel doesn't cover the mínimum requirements. It was awful.

We stayed for 2 nights, had great breakfast both mornings. Better than other Quality Inns we have stayed at this year while traveling. Will be booking a couple more nights in the near future. Great location between Knott's and Disneyland.

Hotels in the Choice Hotel group have to provide a breakfast. This can be just a Danish and coffee, but at the Quality Inn you get far more. Cereal, eggs, fruit, waffles and more. The rooms are large and comfortable. There is easy access to the freeway and Disney is a few minutes away. The only problem we had was noisy neighbours, but the front desk sorted them out very quickly. There is a small shopping mall across the road and I would highly recommend Luis pizzas and pasta. Would go back.

My family and I checked in on Oct. 14, checked out on Oct. 16.  I chose this hotel because it was the best value for me, even though we had to commute to Long Beach all 3 days. The staff was professional and friendly, our room was clean and we were pleasantly surprised that the TV included Direct TV. Having stayed at many hotels between Iowa and California the past 2 years, I expected a less than stellar stay based on the cost.  However, I was wrong. The breakfast was simple, presenting similar offerings as nearly every hotel that lists a "Free Breakfast".  That being said, because I expected less, this impressed me as I've stayed in hotels that were more expensive that offered less.   The pool looked very inviting and we had hoped to go swimming, but had too much going on to

Super nice hotel and staff!   Room clean and bed very comfortable. The hotel is close to the highway which makes it convenient.     free breakfast in the hotel. It was  very good! You can make  waffles choice of cinnamon or regular. They also have eggs, sausage, toast,, cereals, juices, coffee, milk. They had vending machines on the bottom floor and ice machines on every floor..

Summary Heading: Comfortable, clean and away from the crowds
Summary: We stayed at this hotel (room 214) from 8 to 11 October 2014. The building is very close to the highway which is very convenient if you rented a car to do some exploring out of town. It doesnt look like much from the outside, but it's clean, and once we opened the door to our room, I could smell the clean sheets and rugs which was very nice. The beds were comfortable and we had plenty of pillows. The TV was also very nice and it had a very clear picture. We were glad to have the microwave and fridge for the long trip as well. On saturday we were able to watch and hear the Disney fireworks from our window.   What I enjoyed the most was the free breakfast (very good) and the free WiFi. The staff were also very polite. When you are on a budget these things matter. What I did have a

Out of all the quality inns this one is very clean Rooms are huge and spacious, with great cable !  Prices are reasonable and staff is nice . It is centrally located by tons of food spots and banks just 5 mins up the road . Also a target about 10 minutes away . I literally is off the freeway and easy to find
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our survey.  It's very important to us and we can assure you that we will use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests.  Hope to see you soon!!    Best regards,  Laura Santiago Quality Inn  Manager

Summary: I took a summer road trip that included 25 hotels so I am rating each hotel to pay it forward to others for helping me chose my hotels. I am a choice hotel Platinium member for years. This hotel rates a 'B-'. Clean enough you won't go wrong. Not for families. Crack heads passing through parking lot every 5 minutes. Weird people around. Laundry locked at 11pm when we returned in the morning half our laundry was gone. Underwear and all. Front desk guy was cool but lady we explained about laundry looked and said like hey! that is an everyday occurrence around here. Great for Disney location but you can find better for your family. Clean and nice as a couple so you can fend of the druggies passing through. Probably people live there permanently- seems that way and that is never good.

Hotel is clean and rooms very spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was sufficient.  These places are not The Ritz but they offer great value for money.  It's quite close to Disneyland as well and if you have a room on the top floor you can see the Disney fireworks at night.  One word of warning, the hotel is located in Anaheim, but this is not the same Anaheim that is on the subway network it is miles away in Long Beach. We got caught out coming back from Downtown LA and had to pay $70 for a taxi to get us home

Very mixed review of this hotel. We checked in & were sent to a room next to the pool which was occupied by maintaince workers - we had to go get another room. We went up to the 3rd floor got settled & realized the vanity light didnt work. The front desk clerk said it would be fixed that evening & it was not. I had to get ready in the dark the next day. The rooms were small but had a fridge and microwave. The bathroom door doesnt lock? The housekeeping was the best part of the trip.The "free" breakfast would have been good if the entire neighboorhood wasnt eating there each morning. We saw people drive in to parking lot to eat. No where to sit. The neighboorhood was a little sketchy & the police were there several times arresting people. The pool is small & crowded and the hot

We stayed here as a group of 4 couples on a friend vacation. The Choice Hotels website offered an incredibly low rate for the area so we booked online early, confident the "no changes or refunds" policy would not be an issue. About two weeks before our vacation one couple had a job conflict arise. I called the hotel and spoke with Ysenia who was so very kind and helpful. Her willingness to be flexible and assist us gave me a fantastic impression of this hotel before we even set foot on the property. Once we arrived, our experience continued to get better! This hotel is the first I have ever stayed at in Anaheim where I did not have a problem finding parking no matter what time of day we returned to the hotel. My husband originally wanted to book here because of the promise of

The elevator was not working the majority of our stay. The air conditioner was very noisy. The breakfast room was always freezing. The room had been recently painted, but there was no lighting or seating at writing desk. The vanity area did not have enough light. There was no lock on the bathroom door ( you could close the door but not lock it ). All throughout the night there was a noisy vent above. The alarm clock started making a sizzling noise at 1 am. We unplugged it for the rest of our trip. The pool area didn't close until 11pm so we couldn't sleep until then. The room was not vacuumed properly. The tub drained very slow. The internet was so slow I had to use my phone as a wifi hotspot.

Bang for your buck plus good service. Everything went well in our stay. I appreciate their clean rooms, new white linens and bath towels with helpful, smiling staff. The place is also safe and not crowded.

Summary Heading: Good option for the budget minded
Summary: I stayed in a double-bed room with two teenagers. It was very cramped once we added the roll away bed, but it worked well for our needs. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms included complimentary continental breakfast, a small microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot and safe which helped keep food costs down. Also, there is a Mimi's and McDonalds within easy walking distance. The main entrance to Disneyland is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Considering how close the hotel is to the freeway, I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet our room was. Our room did not face the freeway so that might make a big difference. The staff was all super nice and helpful. The day we checked out they stored our luggage in a special room so we still had a whole day of fun. The front desk

This is a little hidden jem! Of you are coming to Anaheim for a night or a week, this Quality Inn is the best budget in town! Clean and close to Disneyland! And the staff if friendly and ON TOP OF THINGS!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  I'm pleased to hear you enjoyed your room and breakfast. We enjoy creating memorable experiences for our guests.  Hope to see you soon!!  Best regards!!

Summary: The waffles where great!the pool is always clean and never crowded. The price was very cheap for the holiday weekend which included breakfast great service and a refreshing pool. No complains. Close to restaurants and downtown fullerton. Great place to stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Great price for the weekend, excellent breakfast, refreshing pool. Rooms are great with a perfect refrigerator and microwave . Definantly a good place for a family trip . Close to restaurants and close to disneyland . If staying their request the third floor to see the disneyland fireworks in the evening.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and that our hotel.  We are glad you enjoyed our breakfast and our refreshing pool.  We hope to see you soon.  Best regards!!

Summary: Stayed there a couple of night rooms were clean and spacious. staff very friendly and helpful. complementary breakfast is good area clean and organize!! Overall a good place to stay!! Most likely will stay here again
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your recent stay with us.  We are delighted you had a great time.  It is always great to hear you enjoyed the service and amenities we provided.  Best regards!

Summary: We were a bit concerned after reading a couple of the other reviews, but after checking in we quickly saw that things were ok. It is clean and looks like it has been recently renovated, although it is an older hotel. Our room had a microwave and small refrigerator, coffee pot and hair dryer. Our only disappointment is no microwave in the breakfast area. To heat up a danish, you have to go back up to your room. We did meet with opposition when we asked to change one of the reservation dates. This hotel was not full and the request was a middle of the week change.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Quality Inn.  We appreciate your positive comments on the cleanliness of our hotel, our amenities we still in renovation and improving.  We hope to see you again in the near future.  Best regards!

Summary: Stayed here last year with my mom in october. It was a good hotel for our little two night stay. The front desk woman was wonderful and explained a question we had concerning an extra charge on the bill. My dad works in house keeping as a manager so we know what to look for when we stay places...no bed bugs, no major stains, no icky bathroom and we even helped take the comforters and sheets off the bed for the lady when we were leaving (ps: thats sort of a good thing to do quickly because then they have no choice but to put clean sheets on). We did find a few tissues or something under the bed but it was no biggy to fish them out and toss them away...didn't prevent us from sleeping good...and after a 16 hour day in disney we were so ready for sleep.  Good location to a lot thats

I came into town for business trip / meeting that was in the area.  So I decided to stay at the Quality Inn since I was familiar with their brand.  When I arrived I was nicely greeted by the front desk staff and checked in promptly and efficiently. When I got to my room everything was clean and orderly.   I would definetly stay here again.  Its nice having free wifi, free morning breakfast, and quiet place to sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you Michael for the review.  Im happy you had a great stay with us.  We hope we see you again for your next business trip.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland at a great price!
Summary: My family and I are annual passholders to the Disney parks.  We often stay in Anaheim and this by far has been one of our favorite hotels.  Disneyland is only 3 miles away and price of Quality Inn is unbeatable.  Our rooms are always clean and the hotel staff is very friendly.  We travel with a little one and the staff always provides us with a crib and clean sheets for our baby.  In the morning the hotel offers a nice complementary breakfast for its guests.  It includes, waffles, eggs, sausage, doughnuts, muffins and more.  My family and I love it!
Manager Response: Krissy, Thanks for taking the time to write a review for us! We always enjoy seeing you and the family when you visit the area.  We try to do everything possible to make you comfortable while your here.  We hope to see you guys again when you come to visit Mickey Mouse!.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Near the Freeway, stores and reasonable price
Summary: Excellent customer service! They attended me quickly and  very kind. Room was clean and a nice pool area. The prices for the rooms were good and reasonable. Great location because it was near the freeway and the stores were down the street! Overall great and excellent stay.
Manager Response: We really appreciate your review, and thank you for staying with us.  We are one of the few hotels located right on the border of Fullerton and Anaheim, and the thing that separates the two is the freeway.  Most of our guests like the location because of the freeway convenience.  Once again thank you for staying with us and hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Convenient location for out of state relatives
Summary: I needed a hotel that was close to shopping and restaurants for my out of state family. This is a great location. I was surprised how inexpensive this hotel is. My nieces loved the waffles that were included in the free breakfast. Only con was the wifi was slow.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review.  Im glad your family enjoyed their stay with us.  I will see what else we can do about our internet speeds.  We are getting a new vendor into the property shortly which will not only increase our speed but increase coverage as well.  Once again thanks for your review and hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: I stayed here for a few days while my house was being renovated.  Now I know where to send my family and friends when they want to come visit my neck of the woods.  Rooms were decent size, clean and the staff was very accommodative (I admit that I can be needed at times.)  It was nice to be so centrally located.  I have lived in Orange County most of my life and had never been to downtown Fullerton.  Since it is only a few blocks from the hotel I decided to check it out....great bars and live music all over the place!  I even managed to catch the Disneyland fireworks show right from my room.  Overall a good experience…especially for the cost!
Manager Response: Im glad you had a great time here with us.  I hope your house turns out nice after the renovations.  We do have quite a few people stay with us for all of the events that happen in downtown fullerton, especially new years eve.  There is tons to do there.  Anytime you or your family needs a room close by please let us know and we'd be more than happen to help you out.  Thanks again for the review.

Summary Heading: nice hotel at a good price
Summary: Stayed overnight here for a quick business trip.  The hotel was good.  Outside looked as if it was bing worked on to sprouse it up, and the room I had which was on the 3rd floor was able to see Disneyland fireworks and Anaheim city lights.  The room was good but it does need a little updating.  Overall it was a nice stay for a quick trip.  Thanks to Belinda at the front desk for helping me figure out my flight ticket home.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to give us a review.  Im glad you liked the location of the room, and yes on the nights Disneyland displays its fireworks you can see them clear as day.  Its a little loud but its defiantly a joy to watch.   We have been working on the hotel to prepare ourselves for the transition from Comfort to Quality.  I will share your review with Belinda, and make sure she gets recognized for her great service.  Thanks again for the review and hope to see you back in the future.

Summary: Had a great stay recently at the comfort inn. Upon arrival the hotel does look a little old but checking in and getting into the room I was quite surprised.  The hotel room was very clean and pretty large for my family of 5.  We visited with family for a few days, and I can say we had a great time the whole way through.  The staff were all friendly and gave us directions were we needed to go. The breakfast was really nice as well.  I would stay here again, when we are in the area.  It seemed while we were there they were going to be a Quality inn so keep you eye out for that.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review, and yes we are changing to a Quality inn, we have lots going on now, and I'm really glad you and your family had a wonderful time while you stayed with us.  We are working on updated the exterior so  next time your in town please visit us, i think your be pleasantly surprised.  Once again thanks for the review.

Summary: DISGUSTING!!! My fiance and I were there this past weekend, to go to the Disney parks.  Since there was a marathon all weekend, a lot of hotels were already booked, so it led us to this miserable place.   After spending all day at Disneyland, we were ready for bed.  We were booked for the third floor and had to haul our stuff up the 3 flights of stairs (not a big deal, if we weren't so dog tired).  As soon as we opened the door, the STENCH of the room hit us like a ton of bricks!! AWFUL!!! {The door said, "Non-Smoking Room", but we'll get into that later... } It was a HOT MUSTY combination of stale, moldy and old cigarette smoke.  The lighting situation, in the room, makes it seem even more scuzzy. I thought I'd turn on the AC to help the air situation, but it helped very
Manager Response: Sorry you had a bad experience at our hotel.  Since your review I took advantage and showed all of my staff.  We are in a transitioning period right now going from a Comfort inn to a Quality inn.  We have a lot of work ahead of us but myself and my staff are all dedicated to turn it around and make things better starting with all of our rooms and outside appearance of the hotel.  Since your stay we have changed the bedding in the rooms, as well as taken care of the landscaping around the entire property.  If you give us a second chance i think you will be impressed.  If you have any further questions please feel free to call us anytime.  Thanks again for bringing these items to our attention.

Summary Heading: OK for one night at least...don't know if I'd stay any longer
Summary: Won on PL, but I was going for a hotel in Fullerton/Brea but ended up with this CI on the border of Anaheim.While it is very "convenient", it would've been better off moving up the street in Fullerton, where there are plenty of shops.  The neighborhood around here isn't like that on the portion closer to Disneyland, and when you don't see so many rental cars in the lot, you start to wonder why. While the price was right, this would be the low end budget for those going to the parks. I was here for one night, and while it had a nice desk where I had to do some work, the Internet was spotty for my phone. I spent most of the time away from the room, though the breakfast was all right in the morning before my appointment in La Habra. Even during the night, if you face Harbor, you
Manager Response: Thanks for telling us about your stay.  We are very centrally located in between Anaheim and Fullerton.  a lot of people stay with us to visit both Disneyland and Downtown fullerton or Fullerton college.  I will look into our internet antennas and see if they are all working to there full potential.  I know how important it is to have fast, reliable internet connections while traveling.  We have since changed over to Quality inn so our breakfast room has changed completely.  We still offer the same great items, but with a different appearance.  We hope you stay with us in the future, once again thanks for the review.

Summary: I've been to Disneyland 14 times in the past 13 years. This was the absolute worst place I've ever stayed. This place needs a renovation, the swamp cooler units outside everyone's windows were sometimes kicked in depending on the room you were in. It smelled musty, didn't have enough towels. The worst part was that I had 2 rooms for our family this past weekend and in both rooms when we turned down the covers, there was some sort of brown runny liquid on the covers. Which freaked us out and we couldn't use enough hand sanitizer. The ceiling has the old popcorn on it except where there is patches, which in one of the rooms was quite a bit. They offer a continental breakfast but the milk was spoiled. The sidewalks are littered with cigarette buts. It's 3 miles from Disneyland so

Being from Las Vegas, we only take sure bets and this was not one of them! This "hotel" was the only part that ruined our perfect weekend getaway. When booking a Comfort Inn Choice Privilege Hotel, we expect more than average - but average would have been so much better!  From a lack of parking, to a non-existent security guard, rust on the bathtub, a door that had water damage and was kicked-in, stains on the wall, a blanket that had a burned tag that looked like candy and staff that felt this was okay and didn't deserve much attention. For a hotel to have 85 possible guests and parking for maybe half, is outrageous - security was to help park us but he was hard of hearing and slow. "...If anything happens to your car, corporate would take care of it..." was the response to my

This hotel was decent a few years ago when I first stayed (2003), now this is another story.  The hotel is directly off the 91 freeway in north north Anaheim, about 3-31/2 north of Disney. The hotel looks horrid from the outside, but I have been bested before by taking a hotel on it's outside looks, but most of the time it represents the whole hotel.  The check-in was stale and not very polite, just very robotic. The company inside and right outside the office was that of homeless and drug users. After check-in I was already planning my escape. I parked and walked to the room assigned, directly across from the pool. I walked in to a musty smell and very very dark room. The room looked and felt dirty. I checked the bathroom and it was clean, to the look. I sat down on the chair

If you are in LA for disneyland, this is the best possible place for an overnight stay...Good breakfast on the house and value for money; otherwise, average property.  the rooms are pretty small...there is little for children to do...there is no travel desk

We vacation to Disneyland and we stayed at the Comfort Inn. Check in was great, but the front desk ladies could use a smile for their guest. Rooms were great, bed and pillows were comfy. Very clean room.....They served a great breakfast, but was very crowded! Overall we had a great stay :)
Manager Response: Glad to hear you were able to enjoy your disneyland vacation with us.  We really appreciate the kind words about our hotel.  I will talk with the front desk and make sure their smiles are always on for our guests.  We really appreciate your stay with us and hope you stay with us again in the future.

Summary: had booked this one sight unseen ( Choice Hotels 800 number)   A MISTAKE I WILL NOT MAKE AGAIN... if there is a promotion  will visit the hotel then call the 800 number from my car......was told to do so when called back to complain ( have to call them to get the special points   what a crock)... Grubby hotel...only good point the bathroom had been redone..........noisy...smelly....no hot water for morning shower...... Choice hotels should revoke their name..................   should have slept in my car........
Manager Response: Im sorry you had a bad experience with booking our hotel.  I would like to get more information as to why we weren't able to provide you with your proper accommodations. If there was anything we could have done to make your stay or reservations better we would have done so.  Please feel free to contact the office 714-635-6461 to discuss what occurred and what we could have done to make your stay with us pleasant.

Summary: Recently stayed here and was very happy with the staff and our room.  It is an easy drive to/from Disneyland.  Breakfast was good and the eating area was very clean.  I will definitely return.  Great rate and was very pleased with my visit.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking time to write about our Hotel.  I'm glad you had a chance to visit Disneyland.  We really appreciate your kind words regarding our hotel.  We try hard to provide a great product for our guests.  Once again thank you for the comments and we do hope to see you back in the future.

Summary Heading: Quick cheap getaway in Anaheim, California
Summary: It's clean and really affordable. Had enough space for 4 people and one of my friend did his INSANITY session next to this bed. Pretty cool space! The location is pretty much ok and the rooms are pretty dated but does the work!
Manager Response: Francois, Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay at our hotel.  I think thats a first to hear about someone doing an insanity work out in one of the rooms, but I'm really happy it worked out for them.  That takes a lot of dedication to do those type of work outs.  We are doing what we can to update the rooms as time allows.  We really hope you come back and see us in the future and see the changes we have made.      Once again thank you for your review and we hope to see you soon!

Summary: The front desk staff was rude, when we arrived i was tired and the young man at the front desk was not friendly or helpful we were there a week the maid was friendly and did a good job but when ever i went to the front desk i felt like i was bothering them and when i was checking out the girl that was working down right pissed me off while we were packing to leave the girl that was working called the room and told us we had 10 min to get out, check out time is 12 we were out by 12:10 i really dont know what her problem was all i know is if i owned that place i wouldnt want here working for me !!!!! there is also lots of riff raff if the parking lot and it is next to a freeway so expect to here some noise .
Manager Response: Dawnajh, I really apologize for your experience here.  We do not operate the hotel like that and defiantly don't want anyone to ever feel like they are bothering our staff.   We normally give about a 30 minute leeway to have our guests check out of the room before asking them to vacant the unit.  I will be having a meeting with the front desk staff to ensure we do not ever make a guest feel the way you felt.  If you need to contact me to discuss this further please contact the office (714) 635-6461 and ask for Corey, I would be more than happy to discuss this with you and what we did to rectify the problem.     Once again sorry for your experience here, and do hope you give us a second chance in the future to treat you right!

Summary: A Friend and I stayed in two rooms for six days. It was my dream trip to California. The motel is dated but was clean. The front desk staff was great and helpful on how to get around California. The house keeping staff where very very nice and kept the room clean and made beds everyday. The room/washroom is dated but from what we saw they are renovating some rooms. Saw carpeting delivered one morning. Wifi service and breakfast was great. Lots of noise at night from unattended kids. It seems there are people that actually live in the motel and some are rough looking. Overall a nice place, every night we watched the fireworks from Disney up the street from right outside out door (rooms 222 and 224). Only negative thing, I went to do laundry one day and turned on the lights in the
Manager Response: Thank you for the review! I'm glad you were able to make your dream come true and visit Disneyland.  As you mentioned and saw we are doing some room renovating and trying to get the property looking great for our guests.  It is an exciting time for us, and do hope to see you back soon.  Rest assure we are taking the laundry room issue into account and are everything possible to correct the problem.  Our main focus is having happy guests and allowing each of them to walk away from here with a positive experience.  I'm glad we were able to make your stay enjoyable.  Please do visit us again, hopefully you'll be able to enjoy some of our new improvements when you return.

Summary Heading: What is the door even for? I can hear everything outside!
Summary: So lets start with the positive. The hotel staff was super nice. The room is clean. The location is 15-min from disneyland and has free parking, free wifi, free breakfast... All of that is officially nullified by the fact that EVERY SOUND FROM OUTSIDE COMES STRAIGHT THROUGH! The sirens going by, the guy with the diesel truck, the teenagers doing it in the next room... Its bad. Heck, you can see light coming in around the perimeter of the door! This is the last time I stay at a "comfort" inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write a review about our hotel.  I do apologize for the noise issues you experienced in the room.  The doors should all be sealed tight with no type of light coming from around the frame.  We have a PMP (preventive maintenance program) in action for our rooms and i will add checking the door seals and frame as part of this program.  We hope you will stay with us again in the future and give us a chance to change your mind and have a nice peaceful, quite stay.  Once again thank you for the review.

Summary Heading: For the price a very good deal
Summary: We stayed here one night after flying here from Australia (14 hour flight) and before going to Disneyland the following day. What a good idea. The room was clean, the service excellent. Check in and out was smooth. Part of the experience is a modest buffet breakfast. All in all it was a very good way to start our vacation and rest before Disneyland.
Manager Response: Jan C, Thanks for the great review!  I'm happy you had a safe and enjoyable trip here to Anaheim, and hope you really enjoyed disneyland.  Our goal is to make every guest happy here, and hope we made your entire stay great.  Please visit us again if you come to Disneyland in the future. Once again thank you for staying with us!

Summary Heading: Overpriced and barely maintained.  Desk staff great!
Summary: This Comfort Inn is one of the seediest in the chain based on my experience.  Most of the guests must be either on bus tours or are booked on Mexican travel sites.  Kids were running around most of the night without any adult supervision.  My bathroom wall was patched but never sanded or repainted.  However, the shower was fine, as was the internet.  The bed was clean and comfortable.  In fact, the entire room was clean.  In spite of that, I am surprised that Choice Hotels keeps the property a Comfort Inn.  The other Anaheim property on Katella is far superior for only a little higher price.
Manager Response: Pklerose, Sorry to hear you had a bad experience her at our property.  We do our best to maintain it in a way that meets all of choice hotel brand standards.  We do book groups from time to time  and I'm sorry they effected your stay.  I will check with my maintenance and housekeeping staff about the bathroom repair the rooms should never go back in service with only half of the repair job completed.  We are working on improving our product and do hope you try us again in the future, we have some exciting things happening now, and should be completed with them in about 4-6 months.  Please feel free to call us and make a reservation.  I think youll be presently surprised on your return.  Corey S, General Manager 714-635-6461

Summary Heading: Not great, but ok for a night or two.
Summary: We didnt spend a whole lot of time during the day here so it was ok.   Negative: When we got there we tried out the pool and it was freezing. The hot tub was warm and the bubbler didnt work. The room smelled like a musty, old hotel that has had too many smokers stay there. I was worried about taking off my shoes in the room because the carpet looked suspicious. The walls are super thin and we could here the people below us. They were nice and went to bed early though. Positive: Even though the floor looked awful the sheets were clean and smelled nice. Pillows were ok. The towels and washclothes were clean and white. Housekeeping did a good job and none of our possesions went missing. Breakfast was actually not bad at all. It was warm and there was a good selection. Close to a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, i have noted these items you have mentioned and will be sure to see what we can do to fix them.  Once again thank you for the review and we really hoe you come back to see us again in the future.  We have some excited things going on now and would love to have you back.

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel Stay In My Life
Summary: I am very surprised this hotel has recieved halfway decent reviews. To start, I was welcomed into my room to the overpowering smell of mold and mildew. I did not complain to the front desk because looking at the outside apperance of the hotel and the condition of the pool I assumed every room would have something I didn't like and I didn't want to switch rooms over and over again. I rationalized in my head that I could deal with a bad odor. Since we were in town to visit family we had a very busy day. I went into the room, dropped off my bags and left. I returned back to the room at 11:30-12 midnight to cops in the hotel, which really didn't make me feel very safe at the property. The door to the room doesn't have springs so it slams behind you and every other room extremely
Manager Response: Let me start off by apologizing for your experience here at our hotel.  You ran into items I would have never thought would get past my housekeeping staff or my maintenance staff in this room.  We have a lot of work to do still at the property and I wanted to let you know I am taking full responsibility of this and making sure not only myself but all of my staff are aware of all of these issues and we do whatever it takes to make sure nothing like this happens to another guest here.  I have set up training meetings with both my housekeeping and maintenance crew so they can re-learn the proper way t clean the rooms as well as the preventive maintenance.  Right now we are really taking action with this and really hope you try us out again in the future and see what changes we have made.  We are all dedicated to this change.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary: The location and value it's worth the stay for sure. It has a pool open till late, good breakfast in the morning and comfortable rooms. Bear in mind that this review comes from and eastern European not used to staying at hotels, so basic in US is luxury where I live. In other words, I enjoyed the property, I stayed twice here and I would definitely stay here again
Manager Response: Thank you for the review, We hope you had a great visit to the States.  your feedback is very helpful and we will be sure to take care of the items mentioned.  Hope all is well, make sure you come and visit us in the near future.

Summary: This place was 5mins walking distance to Disneyland. It was value for me since it was only me and my daughter travelling. We were allocated a room with 2x queen beds and an attached room for the child with its own amenities and TV. Purchased tickets for 2 day trip to Disneyland from reception and it was cheaper than the normal price.  Staff were very friendly, always willing to help. Came with a wide variety of complimentary breakfast. Rooms were cleaned everyday and fresh towels placed on your beds. Didn't loose anything from the room. Would stay there again if i plan on visiting Disneyland again. Even left the staff some Australian souveniers coz i was so impressed with their service.  Great work guys/girls!!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review.  We are really happy you enjoyed your stay with us and hope to see you back soon.

Summary: This Inn is not in the "elite" or "wow factor" class. The rooms are old, the complex could use an upgrade. But then it would be more expensive. The pool is small and not heated. We had to to get a new room twice because the key card readers malfunctioned. But we rented 4 rooms for a family reunion trip. It was comfortable and met our needs as we spent three days in the parks until we traveled to Palm Springs for our real vacation. If you are spending a lot of time at the hotel or inn, then you will be frustrated But if you are just looking for a cheap , clean place to crash, this is it. There is a free breakfast which is awesome and makes it even more of a great deal.

The place is within walking distance of Disneyland and the parking is free. Rooms are comfortable, tv is good, bathrooms fine.  No working wifi and breakfast was very crowded. People would take plates back to their room or stand.

Summary Heading: Fights broke in the parking lot
Summary: We stayed here for 4 long nights while we visited Disneyland.  First off, the parking lot was dirty.  The rep at the front who checked us in was nice, but she tried to pass off a digustingly old room to us. Forgot the room number but it was downstairs right around the corner from the elevator.  The room smelled as if nobody had cleaned it in years and the AC unit was hanging off the wall.  I immediately told my children not to unpack and that we will be changing rooms or hotels ASAP.  The girl then gave us a room on third floor, which looked more like the pictures that are advertised.  She claimed she believes housekeeping may be taking off the AC unit to clean it, if so why were we given the room?  The pool was flithy with dead flies.  My son had to take the scooper on the wall

Stayed here while attending the 2013 NAMM show. It was walking distance from the convention center and had a fantastic breakfast. The only downside is they charged my company for a "smoking" room when I did not smoke and I had to repeatedly call until they finally removed the charge. I could not get the manager to call me back and it was a nightmare after being jetlagged for a week.

Stayed here for 4 nights in oct, rooms were ok clean and basic. We did not feel 100 per cent safe and there were a few incidents with police cars turning up. The girl on reception was really helpful and the breakfast was very good. We chose this hotel for the location and wi fi, but the wi fi only worked for about half an hour in the 4 days we were there.

We checked out several hotels for a three day visit to Disneyland and, by far, this Comfort Inn offered the best value.  The room was quiet,well appointed with a flat screen, fridge, microwave, iron, coffee maker and nice bath.  At $89 per night it was better priced then any other first.class property in the area. It,s about a  six block walk to the theme pearls and half that to nice restaurants.  The check in was easy, and the staff friendly and helpful.  The only negative was minor -- the advertised free  "hot" breakfast was pretty basic.  We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Although we had made reservations ,many months in advance, we found out that the accessible room we had requested and had written on our reservations, was on the 2nd floor. There were no luggage carts available and we could not speak to a manager when we checked in. Being slightly handicapped, It was very difficult carting all the equipment we needed for a convention up to the room. Carpets were very dirty and the maid did not refill our coffee or Kleenex. Very nice desk for our computers in the room and a comfortable bed. Breakfasts were average  and the attendant worked very hard for the large crowd

When we checked in, they gave us room 114. Upon opening the door, it had moldy musty smell. We changed rooms and was moved to a 2nd floor. The room smelled better, but the quality was very poor, the lamp shades were torn and dirty. There were stains on the bedspread, and the sheets were so thin and worn, you could see through them. The room needed a good cleaning and the motel needed some major maintenance. We will never stay there again.

Stayed at this hotel for a couple of weeks while we were waiting for our apartment to be available for move in... We stayed in three rooms throughout our stay and EACH and EVERY one had cockroaches and a very distinct *stench*... We informed the staff of the problem and we were told we had to pay MORE to move rooms because of "availability". Fine. NBD. Once we were in a room that we actually REQUESTED- it was OK.... the best thing about the hotel is the breakfast... people are sketchy, two younger girls in front office are HORRIBLE, once you get on their radar- don't expect to get off... they did just about anything they could to make sure that we werent able to get into a "weekly" room after we had to do a 24 hour checkout...  we finally ended up just leaving because it was

The rooms are clean, they smell like any other hotel in that area with carpet, a little musky. Once you room the air for a bit it gets better. The beds are comfortable and they keep everything very clean. Breakfast was good, eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit, pastries, etc. Its about 10 minutes from disneyland, super easy to get to. Different places to eat in the area. Overall a good place to stay for the price. small pool area but they keep it clean.
Manager Response: Im happy to hear you had a nice stay with us.  We do what we can to keep our property looking sharp.  We will look into the reason as to why the room might have smelly musky.  (Possibly carpet cleaning prior to your arrival?) regardless its an item on the "to do" list and it will be taken care of.  Please if your in town again feel free to give us a call and we will do our best to make your stay enjoyable once again.  Thanks again for your input on our property, and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Rooms were fine but basic and slightly smelly.  Some of the clientele left a lot to be desired and there are some people who seem to stay there long term.  There were often police cars dealing with incidents whilst we were there.  The wifi didn't work for 3 of the 4 days that we were there.  The best thing about this hotel was the breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment.  We are going to continue to work on our rooms to ensure that they are up to par for our guests and meet their expectations.  I'm sorry to hear your room had a funny smell, we would have been more than happy to have offered you another room.  I will look into this issue and get it resolved.  We hope you give us another opportunity to earn your business in the future.  Once again thank you for your feedback.

Summary: This is your usual motel/hotel.  Very clean and tidy rooms.  Breakfast included was good.  Pool area small.  Location very good, 5 minutes to Disney area.  Roads around hotel busy and can be confusing.  Eating places not plentiful but a reasonable selection 2 minutes drive - if you can find them!  Denny's, Soup Plantation, burger place plus a few others.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review on Tripadvisor. We are happy you had a nice stay with us.  Next time you stay with us please feel free to stop by the front desk and ask about area information.  We are all well aware of our area and can help you find anything your looking for.  We also have local maps and brochures that you could take with you to find restaurants you might be looking for.  Thanks again for staying with us and hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Needs a little work, but overall a good experience
Summary: The Comfort Inn down a couple of blocks from Disneyland was an excellent value for our trip.  We originally booked 2 Queen beds for our family of 5, but when we saw the room, we realized we would need a little more space with all our luggage.  The staff was very accommodating, and it was only $30.00 more a night for a small suite (2 queens, and an extra room with bunkbeds for the kids and their own TV.)  The room was clean, cool and quiet, in the back of the hotel, but near the pool, so it was perfect.  There were a few stains on the carpet, and there was some touches of black mold/mildew in the bathroom, but I could see where this is a highly desirable room and probably booked most of the summer, hard to take it out of commission for a day to clean the carpets.  I could handle
Manager Response: Thanks for the review.  Glad you enjoyed your summer.  We will take your concerns about the property and make sure we do everything we can to correct them.  Thanks again for staying with us this summer and look forward to having you with us next time.

Summary Heading: GROSS RUN!!!!!! Would rather spend the night in a public bathroom.
Summary: Like I said, run....... My husband, daughter and I almost threw up ehen we opened the door.  non smoking room.but the smell was horrible. stains on bed spreads, sheets, and the little sofa had feces and urine stains.  I lost the 89.99 they charged and had to go looking for anothrt hotel.  will try and get money back today, plus they have a hold on my funds as if i was going to destroy something that is already  destroyed.  I don't know how people can stay at this roach so called hotel.   pardon to the roaches for insulting them.  would rather eat a roach than stay here and i think that says it all.
Manager Response: Im really sorry to hear you had a bad experience at our property.  I can assure you we do everything we can to maintain our property and our rooms.  We are looking into this, and we will make sure this will be corrected.  Thanks again for your review and hope you will give us a second chance to stay with us in the future.

Summary: I have been in the hotel industry for over 25 years and for your dollar value the customer service,breakfast buffet and overall cleanliness of the hotel is excellent. The rooms have microwave and fridge, nice desk area, A/C and Heater that actually worked. Our room 237 and 240 were spacious and very clean. The pool is small but comfortable and jaccuzi was refreshing. Breakfast buffet included fresh waffles, pastries, apples, bananas, oranges, yogurt, cereal, breads, eggs, sausage,english muffins, donuts. The housekeeping staff went out of there way to service our needs. Hats off to them. It's not Ritz-Carlton so don't go there if your looking for that 5 star hotel but for $79 it was excellent. We will stay at this hotel everytime we go to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Well, Thank you for staying with us.  Im glad you enjoyed your rooms overlooking the pool area. I'm happy your were able to enjoy our large breakfast spread.  A lot of time goes into setting up breakfast so the more people who enjoy it the better.  Our staff has been here for years and really strives to make people feel at home.  We thank you for your comments and hope to have you stay with us in the future.

Summary: The room had a bad smell.  The room was dark and bedding old looking.  The sheets were thin and rough.  The chair in the room had nasty stains as did the carpet.  Paper thin walls.  Could hear everything outside of and next to our room.  The price was right for the area.
Manager Response: Im sorry to see you disliked our room when you stayed with us.  We are up to date with all of the comfort inn standards regarding the bedding.  The sheets are 200 thread count.  We have the housekeeping in the rooms on a daily basis, to prevent stains on the carpet and other items in the room not being addressed.  We missed the mark on this room.  Next time if you stay with us please feel free to contact the office (open 24-7) and see about switching rooms.  We try our best to accommodate every guest.  Thank you for the comment and hope you give us a second chance.

I didn't have the time to wait so I left.  I wasn't even going to write a review after they charged my credit card on a night I used my points to stay thinking it was an honest mistake and they would fix it quickly, but after getting someof the worst customer service I have ever had, I decided to write this review.  I called three days in a row trying to talk to a manager to get things sorted out, and I never received a call back.  It wasn't until I called my bank to dispute the charge and my bank
Manager Response: Thank you for the comment.  We are taking this matter very seriously and want to ensure you this is not that way we treat our guests.  We will have a staff meeting to discuss these issues and make sure they don't happen to any other guests.  If the breakfast room was set up, the attendant could have let you in to get your breakfast and start your day.  As for the communication for the manager I apologize. I try and resolve any issues as quickly as possible.  I don't see how there was such a lack of communication.  Please in the future when staying in the area give us a second chance and I bet you'll see a difference.  Thanks again for your comments, it helps us create a better guest experience for the future.

Summary: Clean Rooms  Near to Disney Land Microwave and Fridge  TV wih Kids channel Good BreakFast You can take a Shuttle to Disney , if you prefer not to have the parking issue. Overall its a good place if you book in advance
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. Im really happy your vacation with us was successful.  Im glad we were able to accommodate you with all your needs.  Thanks again for the comments and we look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Clean room but beware of transients, not for Disney-going families
Summary: Stayed for 1 night with 17 yr old son while visiting baseball parks in Southern Ca. Only about 5-6 miles from Angels stadium and even closer for Disney if going there. Right off highway 91. I stayed in many other Comfort Inns during this trip and all were pretty clean with decent staff. I did research the other places I stayed on this site but winged it on this one. When I called earlier in the day and was told the rate was $64 I knew it would be for a reason but was willing to take the chance. When we arrived the outside looked a bit old and there were some beat up looking clunkers in the lot. The office for check-in was fine and the person was very pleasant. As I was driving around to other side of property to our room I noticed several of the rooms around the backside
Manager Response: Thank you for the review.  We are taking your comments into consideration and fixing what we can.  Regarding people "living" here.  We do get contracts from local and out of state companies that do work in the area, and allows their employees to stay with us for certain lengths of time.  This makes it easier on the employees who live out of state to work and not have to worry about the expense of a long commute,and they stay with us until their jobs are completed.  We fell like we are in a great location though and have nice rooms for families wanting to visit disneyland, knots berry farm, and other local attractions like Angel stadium or Honda center.  We really appreciate your feedback and will do everything we can to address your concerns.  Please don't hesitate to stay with us in the future. I'm sure your experience will be great!

Summary: The rooms were very dirty. There was no security lock on the door and the door was destroyed so that it would not even close all the way. There were bugs in the room. At night there were prostitutes walking around in front of our children. When we complained to the front desk, we were told there was nothing could be done because we paid a lower rate. It doesnt matter what you pay its not worth it. Management was NO help!

Summary Heading: Clean but would never stay again
Summary: This hotel was very clean.  The lady who cleaned our room was very sweet and always had our room clean when we would get back.  The staff all seemed very friendly.  Why we would never stay here again was because most the 3rd floor were people who actually lived there.  At one point one of the ladies that lived there told us that there are plenty of people that are doing drugs that live there.  We were there for about a week and everyday there were cops there and one day the cops were there twice.  We pretty much stayed gone from the hotel during the day and just slept there at night, which I do have to say their beds were very comfy.  So, if you want to go and just sleep there and have a clean room then this is the place to stay.  But, other than that if you want to feel safe I

Summary Heading: Cheap but not upto it for a good stay
Summary: I was there for 1 night - the plan was just to get some sleep and that I did. I took a smoking room with queen size bed which was the best for a solo traveler.  The good part :  Is cheap - They have rooms starting at 70 USD and 2 can be comfy on the king size bed. Breakfast is a above average. Rather a bit above average. The staff are friendly and nice. Let them know in advance and they let you extend the 12PM checkout by an hour or 2 Right off the freeway 91. Is that an advantage? maybe..  The bad part: Just one elevator in some corner of the building. Not good if you have a lotsa luggage. Skip it if you are family. The rooms are old, the bathrooms are bad, the shower is useless and no toilet paper. Nor was the room cleaned in the morning when I was away for work. Free wifi

Summary Heading: The Worst Hotel I Have Ever Stayed At.
Summary: My family and I were on a 2 week vacation to CA.  We stayed in a lot of hotels while on our trip, and this was the worst of the whole trip.  We were on the bottom floor, and the people over us were so loud, jumping on and off beds, running, etc.  The layer between the first and second floor was not very thick, because we heard EVERYTHING.  The bathroom was also gross.  It had mold in a few spots, and there was hair in the bath tub.  The air conditioning is on a sensor, so when you leave it turns off.  It kept turning off at night and got extremely hot.  I would not recommend this hotel, but if you must stay request a room on the second floor.  The free breakfast room was also extremely crowded.  The woman taking care of putting out the food, and etc was super nice.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with young children!
Summary: This hotel was very clean and comfortable for my family's trip to Disneyland.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The pool was clean and refreshing after a long day with Mickey.  We will definitely stay here on our next trip.

Took my family on Disneyland and found this a good location about a mile. Instead of walking which will make children tired before getting to Disneyland we took the city bus which is every 20 min and bought the ticket at the hotel front desk. The clean room with 2 queen bed is fine with fridge but no microwave. Sometimes it is noisy with travelers even in the middle of the night. Breakfast is just fine with plenty of carbs, fruits, hard boil eggs, coffee and tea. I look at the pool but did swim and it seems dirty at that time. Found out there are lots of restaurant and other hotels nearby.

Summary Heading: Location, Location, Location and Great Value
Summary: The Hotel is very clean and quiet. it is located just far enough from Disneyland, (about 3 miles north) and the tourist belt to be more reasonable in price and quiet but  near more restaurants and shopping centers that are frequented by the more knowledgeable locals and frequent travelers. The hotel staff, (front desk, chambermaids and maintenance personnel) are top notch. They are eager to please, knowledgeable and quite friendly. Whenever I am in Southern California I stay at this hotel. It is a convenient drive and centrally located between San Diego and Santa Barbara. THE TWO MUST SEE PLACES IN CALIFORNIA.
Manager Response: Very delighted to hear your stay was worth great value and your feedback is very much appreciated thank you.

Summary: My husband and I decided to go for the weekend and just decide to stay in Anaheim.  Everything seem sold out but we drove and drove with out luck until we got to this hotel and they had a room which end up being the best in the whole entire stay.  Room was really clean and fresh, front desk was VERY HELPFUL!!!!  I was help by two of them Belinda & Erika they both had a smile on their face and made me feel like if they knew me just like home!!!   I will bring my family next time with us now I know where to stay aswell...
Manager Response: Thank you so much I am very glad you enjoyed your stay here at the Comfort Inn. I hope you visit soon in the near future

Summary Heading: A little scary, but room was fine.
Summary: First of all, it took us forever to find this place.  It said close to Disneyland, so we drove all up and down the road looking for this motel.  We finally called, and the very helpful staff told us where to go.  It is FAR from Disneyland, and not on the Disneyland side of the freeway, so just ge forewarned.  It wasn't a big deal, since we had a car and could drive in the next morning.  However, the area is a little scary.  Two women got arrested for prostitution in the parking lot on our second night.  We felt a little uncomfortable parking our car in the lot.  It wasn't bad with just my husband and myself, but if our daughter had been there too, I would have been worried.  I didn't really see any other families with kids staying there.    The walkways to the rooms feel like

Summary: When we checked out the property on the web, it was made out to look like it was near Disneyland, when we arrived in was a 15 minute drive. The hot tub was broke, which is a important part of our stay when we vacation at Disneyland. We love a hot tub after a long day of walking and waiting in long lines. I had to ask for a discount, they didn't seem happy about it, she told me we could cancell and go somewhere else. I asked to look at a room before I made up my mind, she let us, the room smelled really bad and the bed where are hard. Needless to say we went somewher else. it was a little more but worth it. Summary: I recently stayed in another comfort inn which was a great experience. But it brought back bad memories of this place. This is a tiny hotel located at not so great location. The room was cheap and they put us in an "accessible room" which we did not ask for. But it meant the bathroom had a hand shower with a folding chair attached to wall instead of a bath tub. But worst part was that the bathroom floor had slope *away* from the drain hole and as a result you would be standing in a 2 inch deep water while taking a shower. The hotel management was not helpful at all. The breakfast room was tiny and the offerings were less than normal comfort inn standard. If you are visiting Disneyland pay few bucks more and stay at the comfort inn main gate. Its also hard to find parking at

Summary Heading: Best value for money on our whole trip..... Highly recommend
Summary: This was a last minute selection based on the fact we only needed a quick stop for the night and head off to Disney early doors. We had pre-ordered a crib for our 11 month old baby. The girl at reception went to get it and we didnt see her for another 20 minutes. I went back down to reception to find out what happened and she said that she couldnt find it. I then told her we would have to check out and go to another hotel. She actually rang round for us to see what hotels had cribs available. It was round midnight by this time. In the end she decided to go and have another look for the crib. Lo and behold 10 minutes she turned up at our room with a crib!!! The beds were comfortable. There was free WIFI internet.
