Manager Response: Thank you for your comment. I'm so glad our staff was able to find a way to assit you and turn your stay around. I hope for you to continue to visit our property when you are in our Anaheim.

Summary: I work part time in Anaheim and live 100 miles away.  For the past 3 years, I have been staying here 1-2 nights a week to help ease the travel. The staff is friendly, always attentive and helpful.  As I arrive, Erika and/or Belinda are smiling and take care of me right away - they know which rooms are my favorite and whenever possible try to place me in one of them (so far they're at 100%!!).  The rooms are very clean and are perfect with a desk to work at, a small fridge, microwave, coffee pot, TV, and a comfy matress for sleeping (I love the plush comfortor!). Bertha is generally the person who has cleaned my room - she is awesome in detail as she gets my room ready and freshens it each day.  If I have a problem with anyhthing, the engineer - Agustin - takes care of it
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel.  I have posted this review on the staff bulletin board for all my employees to see.  My staff and I would once again like to Thank You for staying with us for so many years and we look forward to serving your hospitality needs in the future.

Summary: I booked this motel in a rush.... was backpacking at the time in Australia and did not have much time to find somewhere. If I'd had the time I'd have booked somewhere closer to Disneyland - having said that....  The motel staff were really nice and friendly and most importantly, helpful. We did not have a car and they directed us to a bus stop just outside that took us to Disneyland in a few minutes and one round the corner which took us to Knotts in about 10 minutes.   Just up the road (opposite way to Disney) is a big outdoor mall with discount clothing shops, a massive supermarket and a fantastic health food shop. There was also a discount disney store selling last seasons stuff really cheaply.   The room was nice and large, all electricals worked fine. If you have a car I'd
Manager Response: Thank you for your response Travelling_Gem.     My staff and I would like to thank you for staying with us here while in Anaheim.

Summary: Good news: the hotel is cheap and clean, rooms are well equipped (fridge, space, desk). The staff is friendly but seemed rather incompetent. The free WLAN didn't work when I was there. The pool is small but clean, in the corner of the parking lot. The walls are thin, so if you got a 4-piece family in the room next to you, be sure to have some earplugs with you. The A/C stinks.  Price/value ratio is OK.
Manager Response: We at the Comfort Inn Anaheim truly appreciate your taking the time to express your concerns about our hotel.  The staff and management at the Comfort Inn Anaheim welcome every opportunity to improve our product and service to our valued guests.   I have read your comments and am happy to hear that you enjoyed having the fridge, desk and that the staff was friendly but am deeply concern that my staff was not able to provide you with the information needed.  I have since had a staff meeting to go over the importance of being able to give or get the necessary information that the guest is requesting.  We have also since fixed and upgraded our WIFI Internet and also now provide 24hr wireless support.  We have also implemented a new maintenance program for cleaning and servicing our A/C units.

Summary Heading: Great Rate, Not So Great Service
Summary: We were able to book a great rate for the hotel. I was a bit nervous that it would be a dive. I was very relieved when we arrived. The hotel is nice and clean.  the good: - comfortable and clean rooms - good continental breakfast - great rate  the bad: - poor service: One example-some people in our group did not have their luggage. They called the front desk if they could get some toiletries. The front desk replied in a rude tone of voice, "come down and get them." - One of the room reservations was mixed up and we lost the great rate when the room rate doubled. The manager would not offer the initial rate, even though it was their mistake.  Overall, I would recommend this hotel as it was clean, quiet, comfortable, and was a short distance from Disneyland.

Stayed for a night in Oct, didn't have a particular hotel in mind after driving back from San Diego so found this just off the freeway. A twin queen room cost $119 incl taxes etc so happy with the price. However, the room faced onto the freeway and it was very noticeably loud. I tried to get another room, but was told the window was probably open which of course it wasn't. Maybe I have sensitive hearing but the sliproad outside made it hard to sleep. Didn't try the pool, but eventually got to use the business centre to get on the internet, which was fine, but then my room card wouldn't work ( as you gain access using your card to the internet room). Breakfast was standard comfort inn, the children enjoying the pancake/waffle maker, so gave us a good start to the day. Access to

Summary Heading: OK Hotel - not close to Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a last minute weekend trip to DL and to see an Angels game. We normally stay within walking distance to DL, but this time it was so last minute we decided to try driving to the parks.   The hotel was clean. We had a large desk in our room and there was plenty of room for everything. We had a king bed and it was OK, not the most comfortable bed I have ever been in, but it wasn't like sleeping on a rock either.  It was pretty quiet, even being so close to the freeway, except when we flushed the toilet, there was a lot of "pipe noise" like you would hear in an older house. We didn't really hear other rooms flushing, but in our room it was pretty loud.  The pool was small and is in the middle of the buildings so it is pretty shaded. There was also a

We just got back from a 3-night stay at the Comfort Inn Anaheim. We turned the corner off of the freeway from the LAX airport and there was the hotel.  We have never driven the LA freeways, so we were happy with this convenience. A basic hotel, that is clean and approx. 5 minutes to Disneyland via the local bus. The continental breakfast was more than basic...cereal, make- your-own waffles, danish, fruit, juices, coffee.   The staff (with one exception) were friendly. We would stay here again and we would recommend this hotel to our friends with family. The only negative thing was that in the 3 days that we stayed here, there was a police car on the property every day.  Now you can take that as a good thing...or a not so good thing.

I stayed here in November during a trip to Disneyland. Would i stay here again? Probably not. It's not the Bates Motel by any means, but I wouldn't say it's the lap of luxury either.   I was pleasanty surprised about the size, cleanliness and quality of the room. We booked nonsmoking; we did actually receive a nonsmoking room. The bedding and pillows were clean; the bathroom was decent, and the room had a tidy appearance. the amenities were impressive, especially for the price, and included a microwave, fridge, large television and coffee maker. It was far beyond what I'd usually expect from a motel-type property.  In addition, the desk clerks were all very friendly and pleasant. There were no issues with them. Don't stay in this hotel unless you enjoy getting scabies.  We stayed two nights.  They didn't make the bed between the first and second night -- which bothered us -- but the next day we realized we also had scabies!   How do I know?  Well, my girlfriend is a dermatologist -- so it's her job to know!  We had to use two tubes of Permethrin to get rid of them all.    We complained to the management, who wrote us a useless letter, and Choice Hotels International, which also wrote us a useless letter.  Neither denied the problem.  How could they?   In sum, don't stay here.  It will cost you more for medical treatment later. (Luckily it was free for me.)

Summary Heading: Loved the ticks, mites, fleas and front office personnel lacking in judgement
Summary: Though rates are "relatively" ok and convenient to the 91 freeway the rooms seem to have little creatures that bite. Spraying Alcohol (70%) would alleviate the problem until the room was "cleaned" again. Seems like these little creature come in with the bedding or the cleaning person.  Some front office personnel seem to lack good judgment and/or common sense. I heard another guest (an Asian lady) also complain to the front office clerk about poor service and being bitten and the clerk (an Indian lady) that particular time just brushed the Asian lady off. Obviously they have not heard of Hotels/Motels/Inns being sued for this very thing. Due-diligence is a non-native term at the Anaheim comfort "Inn" rather "persona-non-grata." Summary Heading: Remember everything looks better at night!
Summary: The night photo made this hotel look nice, boy was I fooled! If you are used to staying in larger rooms stay clear of this place. However, I can say that the beds are comfortable and our room was clean, without any visable damage. It was also odor free. It is close to a lot of places to eat and a straight shot to Disneyland. It is right next to the freeway and on a busy street. It was noise free. The continental breakfast has a juice machine,waffle maker,danishes,2 types of cereals( flakes and cheerios) and breads. We stayed here for 3 nights and I dreaded coming back to my room all 3. People,pay a little more for a nicer place. But if you are on a budget like we were it fits the bill!

My girlfriend came to visit me December 2005 from France, we stayed at this particular Comfort Inn because of it's convient location.  We stayed there a total of 11 days.  We requested the rooms to be cleaned only 2 twice during our stay.  During on one of the days that the room was to be cleaned, we came home early in the morning around 1:30 am only to find our door open.  We checked our room to see if anything was missing.  We didn't notice anything major missing.  But on the day of our check-out, my girlfriend couldn't find her diesel limited edition jacket that was given to her for her 18th Birthday.  We went to the lobby and told the manager and he said that he would look into it.  We went back and forth, I kept getting the same responce..."I'm waiting on the Coorporate

We stayed here for 4 nights during our Disney visit.Really cheap and cheerful, rooms were clean and staff friendly.Free wireless internet and continental breakfast.Use of a pool and laundry facilities Little bit noisy but our room was on ground floor facing the car park

My husband and I were in town for a wedding and just needed an inexpensive place to stay.  This really was a great deal!  We paid $56/night.  The staff was very friendly and helpful upon checking in, which was the only interaction we had with them.  The rooms have been updated, so the furniture and bedding was new.  We had a king size bed with a work desk (nice desk), dresser, TV, etc.  The bathroom was small, but the vanity/sink was separate from the shower/toilet, so it was fine.  The breakfast was cereal and muffins with milk, juice and coffee - fine for free.  My only suggestions would be to get a room facing the inside courtyard - we were on the back side, ground floor, so we heard everyone getting into and out of their cars in the morning. It's a cheap pick. Room was spacious. Had a couch, t.v., breakfast in the lounge. Not a luxury hotel. Didn't have any problems. I was comfortable :).

Right off of the freeway.  Wireless internet. Staff was friendly.  Rooms are very small.  Bathroom smaller. Older rooms.  Not very clean. A/C functioned but the controls were kicked in and no visible markings to distinguish between settings.  No coffee machine.  Muffins, danish, cereal, juice and coffee for breakfast.
